t: Psalm 37
Security of Those Who Trust in the Lord, and Insecurity of the Wicked.
A Psalm of David.
Do*pn not fret because of evildoers, Be*ln not envious toward wrongdoers.
For*ln they will wither quickly like the grass And*ln fade like the green herb.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s and do good; Dwell*ln in the land and cultivate faithfulness.
Delight*ln yourself in the Lord;*s And*ln He will give you the desires of your heart.
Commit*ln your way to the Lord,*s Trust*ln also in Him, and He will do it.
He*ln will bring forth your righteousness as the light And*ln your judgment as the noonday.
Rest*ln in the Lord*s and wait patiently for Him; Do*ln not fret because of him who prospers in his way, Because*ln of the man who carries out wicked schemes.
Cease*ln from anger and forsake wrath; Do*ln not fret; it*i leads*i only to evildoing.
For*ln evildoers will be cut off, But*ln those who wait for the Lord,*s they will inherit the land.
Yet*ln a little while and the wicked man will be no more; And*ln you will look carefully for his place and he will not be there.*i
But*ln the humble will inherit the land And*ln will delight themselves in abundant prosperity.
The*ln wicked plots against the righteous And*ln gnashes at him with his teeth.
The*ln Lord laughs at him, For*ln He sees his day is coming.
The*ln wicked have drawn the sword and bent their bow To*ln cast down the afflicted and the needy, To*ln slay those who are upright in conduct.
Their*ln sword will enter their own heart, And*ln their bows will be broken.
Better*ln is the little of the righteous Than*ln the abundance of many wicked.
For*ln the arms of the wicked will be broken, But*ln the Lord*s sustains the righteous.
The*ln Lord*s knows the days of the blameless, And*ln their inheritance will be forever.
They*ln will not be ashamed in the time of evil, And*ln in the days of famine they will have abundance.
But*ln the wicked will perish; And*ln the enemies of the Lord*s will be like the glory of the pastures, They*ln vanishâ€”like smoke they vanish away.
The*ln wicked borrows and does not pay back, But*ln the righteous is gracious and gives.
For*ln those blessed by Him will inherit the land, But*ln those cursed by Him will be cut off.
The*ln steps of a man are established by the Lord,*s And*ln He delights in his way.
When*ln he falls, he will not be hurled headlong, Because*ln the Lord*s is the One who holds his hand.
I*ln have been young and now I am old, Yet*ln I have not seen the righteous forsaken Or*ln his descendants begging bread.
All*ln day long he is gracious and lends, And*ln his descendants are a blessing.
Depart*ln from evil and do good, So*ln you will abide forever.
For*ln the Lord*s loves justice And*ln does not forsake His godly ones; They*ln are preserved forever, But*ln the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
The*ln righteous will inherit the land And*ln dwell in it forever.
The*ln mouth of the righteous utters wisdom, And*ln his tongue speaks justice.
The*ln law of his God is in his heart; His*ln steps do not slip.
The*ln wicked spies upon the righteous And*ln seeks to kill him.
The*ln Lord*s will not leave him in his hand Or*ln let him be condemned when he is judged.
Wait*ln for the Lord*s and keep His way, And*ln He will exalt you to inherit the land; When*ln the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
I*ln have seen a wicked, violent man Spreading*ln himself like a luxuriant tree in its native soil.
Then*ln he passed away, and lo, he was no more; I*ln sought for him, but he could not be found.
Mark*ln the blameless man, and behold the upright; For*ln the man of peace will have a posterity.
But*ln transgressors will be altogether destroyed; The*ln posterity of the wicked will be cut off.
But*ln the salvation of the righteous is from the Lord;*s He*ln is their strength in time of trouble.
The*ln Lord*s helps them and delivers them; He*ln delivers them from the wicked and saves them, Because*ln they take refuge in Him.
